treatment.etymology: [Greek trichos , hair, and stigma , stigma, in reference to the penicillate stigma]
treatment.description: Shrubs or vines, perennial. Leaves alternate. Inflorescences axillary or terminal racemes, 5–30-flowered. Flowers: sepals 4; stamens 8–13[–25]; carpels 1; ovary 1-loculed; style absent; stigma 1, penicillate. Fruits berries, black, subglobose. Seed 1.
treatment.discussion: The fruits of Trichostigma are sometimes described as drupes.
